file_content.text: Hurry. This sack of slime is going to slow you down enough already.
Hurry. The commander is waiting.
If you hadn't come when you did, those would be our smoking corpses there, no question.
Unfortunately, we're not done, not until this wreck's data is in the hands of Commander Viqui.
Give me what you have. I'll get it to the commander.
Consider it done.
We've recovered all the high-priority info. If you run that to the outpost, I'll hold off what's left of the scavengers until our reinforcements arrive.
You won't need me for that.
If I had my men, sure, but we've only scratched the surface of the Endar Spire's data. We've got the high-priority stuff, but we need every log and every camera.
If I take off with the delivery, that leaves the slicers helpless. If you go, I can defend us until reinforcements arrive.
I liked it better when you were thanking me.
Let's go back to the praise.
Well, hugs and kisses to the lot of you.
Well, hats off to you, Master Jedi.
Well, I salute your prowess, sir.
Well, I'd offer a salute, but that don't mean much to someone like you.
Best way you can help is to take this datapad to Commander Viqui at the outpost. I can defend the team until reinforcements arrive.
Look out! Here they come again!
I think they sent reinforcements!
No time to talk. Here they come!
Lieutenant Karlsu. I'm all that's left of Commander Childress's fifth detail. Please tell me you're our reinforcements.
Childress sent me. What cut you off?
What's the situation?
Childress sent us. You got trouble?
What's the situation?
Your hopes are answered.
You find anything on this wreck worth saving?
I'm here for the data.
Give me a moment. All's clear, guys. And we've got some muscle from back on base.
This is what's left of our research team. The others got ambushed while working.
Scavengers must have guessed we were after something good. We need to hold them off long enough for the research team to recover and download that data.
I'm on point. Researchers inside; anyone who's not working, fan out behind me.
I'll take over now.
Aye, sir, aye.
Lightsabers in front. Anyone with blaster weapons at the door to protect the researchers.
I'm in charge now.
I'm honored to fight alongside a Jedi, sir.
Get the researchers inside, then stay behind me. I want a clear line-of-sight.
I'll take the lead.
With the Force on our side, we have to win.
Frontal assaults aren't my thing. I'll start killing, and you're welcome to join in.
You want me to lead?
I'm not looking for leadership, just a strong arm and a good eye.
Let's start.
Okay. Data's priority one. Everyone into the ship. Go!
Tell the captain we need reinforcements!
Lead the assault; I'll surprise them from behind.
You take point.
You've got to be kidding! Maybe you're ready to go through that nightmare again, but count me out!
Maybe I should get some of the wounded out of here.
I could get him back to base.
Yes! Take me with you. I don't want to die for holo-images.
Why would you stay here?
Yeah! We have the priority stuff. How many people are we going to throw away on this?
It's been three hundred years. We can't know which data is still useful. We got the black box, which was our priority.
But the minute we leave the wreck, the scavs will be all over it, so we can't go until it's stripped bare. I'll wait for reinforcements.
Please! If you leave, take me with you! I don't want to die out here.
We should at least get the wounded out of here.
I'll take him with me.
Sorry. I don't think I can.
You're just whining.
You've got a job to do. The Republic deserves your best efforts.
Quit complaining.
You think none of them have ever been wounded in the line of duty? Suck it in and go back to work.
Listen to the Jedi. If your cause is just, you can overcome any pain. Or something... that's what they teach, right?
Listen to the expert. Every soldier in this army has had to carry on despite injuries.
Listen to that! And he's never served the army a day in his life, right?
Listen to that! And she's about the farthest thing from a soldier you'll meet in these parts.
But I'm not a soldier. I signed on for salvage work! Please, take me back with you. I don't want to die out here.
Look, he's right, we may see more casualties. But it's the data that matters, we knew that when we signed on.
You drag him with you, he's just going to slow you down. And if you fall, everyone here will have died for nothing.
I can't stand to see one more life lost to this cause.
I'll take him.
Thank you! Thank you! I'll name my first child after you.
Well, not all of you.
Well, if I ever have a child. Not a lot of women here on Taris....
Not the smartest move, but you don't lack for guts. One of the slicers got our coms back up, so I'll tell Commander Viqui to expect you.
Getting that data to Commander Viqui is the most important thing.
He'll only slow me down.
But--!
They've made their decision, so no bellyaching from you!
She made the right choice. Now you stuff it.
He's doing the right thing. You just think about it.
We'll take care of you the best we can, but this data could save millions.
Let's get this to Commander Viqui before those Sithspawn regroup. Our coms are back up, so I'll tell her to expect you.
Please--get the data to Commander Viqui. It's the only way to be sure all of our work doesn't go to waste.
Thank you for protecting us. And good luck.
You'll need to reactivate the generator subsystems as we go, so we can grab the data when we hit the main computer. We'll follow you.
Watch and learn!
